name: Hilton Athens

reviews.text: The Hilton Athens is located near the city center of Athens, and a 35-40 Euro cab ride from the airport, or a 6 Euro subway ride and a short walk from the station across the road from the Hilton. One downside to the subway is it only leaves the airport every thirty minutes.
reviews.title: Good but....Hotel Internet Needs Serious Help, and a bit noisy.
Outstanding Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and modern, and is close to many of the tourist areas of Athens. The executive floor on 11 offers a good view of the city and a typical executive lounge fare of drinks and continental breakfast. The rooftop bar on the top floor offers a great view at sundown.

Although high quality hotels are relatively limited in downtown Athens, and the Hilton is one of the better properties, I can suggest three things that one should consider when staying at this property.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) The internet at this property – rots. There is a system for wireless (WiFi) which works in the lobby and on the 11th floor executive lounge. There is another DIFFERENT system that works in your room. At a “mere” 29 euros per day, at a business hotel, one should expect an integrated system that allows the use of wired and wireless internet. And, one should expect a system that works! At this Hilton, you get the “privilege’ of buying two services if you are going to do any work in your room – and outside of your room. In addition, the internet in the conference rooms downstairs didn’t work at all. Complaints to the management were met with a bit of puzzled looks, and when informed that I was a frequent traveler they suggested that they might look into it, but then again, who knows.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: 2) This property is near two major roads. I have attached a photo from our balcony to show the view and the traffic. Even being on the 12th floor, the road noise at night was more than one would expect. There isn’t much the hotel can do about this, but you should be aware if you are a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Top Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for one night during our week long stay in Athens. We have arrived at the hotel early afternoon after a long flight from the U.S., we were very pleased to find a very clean and modern room with a view. The room itself was not very large, but came with a very spacious bathroom (separate tub and shower stall). We wished we could have afforded to stay more nights.
reviews.title: Nice but pricy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I finally turned in my points and was treated better than I ever expected. Upgraded for 2 rooms for 2 nights on my reward points! I got late check out (but only on one room, which was a bit upsetting - I felt they could have extended the courtesy further but....) The most important thing was the overall stay - a beautiful hotel with Crabtree & Evelynn products and a FANTASTIC executive lounge. The marble shower with rainfall option has me redecorating my home shower. The whirlpool tub is great after all the walking you do. The rooftop bar is filled with locals who are a bit snobbish and rude at times but the staff there seems toknow the guests from the rest and treats you accordingly. The view there is worth all the smoke clouds and the rudeness and once out on the terrace you will be happy to have gotten there - bring your camera! The in room - complimentary bottled water, wine and fruits was delightful. The hotel is 2 blocks from the Metro which can get you anywhere in the city for .80Euro. Its faster, cheaper and a lot more fun than the taxis; the traffic in Athens awful and quite honestly - the cab drivers (for the most part) are jerks. I had to offer 3 times regular fare one evening to get from Syntagma to Hilton (the Metro had closed for the night) just to get one to consider stopping. It is a short distance but was raining and I guess they didn't feel it was far enough for their time. My taxi driver from the airport was AWESOME but I ended up taking a 3 Euro direct bus back to the airport. I loved the HIlton and I really beleive you will too.
reviews.title: HHonors stay above reproach!

likes.liked: — View, Service, Executive Level Lounge, shower and location.
likes.disliked: — pricey internet, late check out option was not available for both rooms - inconvenient and I think they could have done more on this account.

reviews.text: Booked two nights at this property with Hilton Honors points, so I can only comment on how pricey things are in the hotel for those who pay for this stuff.
reviews.title: Pricey!

reviews.text: The internet was over 18 euros for 24 hours of access and the movies on the television were practically 20 euros. The hotel itself is excellent, really nice inside with great facilities. But it is not in the immediate center of town and really pricey so be warned.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Hilton

reviews.text: Just returned from an incredible trip to Athens and my stay at the hotel was great. The Hilton doesn't look like much from the outside but definitely makes up in the interior what it lacks on the exterior. Our rooms were smaller than your average Hilton but definitely more spacious than what I expected for a European hotel. The rooms had a smart design and great use of space with faux hardwood floors, sofa, cocktail table, utility desk and modern marble bathrooms. We were on the 6th floor with a view facing a noisy intersection. The great thing about it is the street noise couldn't even be heard if the sliding doors were closed. The hotel has a really cool bar called Galaxy that offers balcony seating and a stunning view of the Acropolis especially at night when it is all lit up -even the locals hang out there. The drinks are overpriced (if you do the conversion from Euro to USD) but my advice is to always buy liquor when you land and there are several reasonably priced package stores in Omonia which is not too far away. The hotel is about 15 minutes walking distance from Syntagma square so we were able to walk just about everywhere. If you are not into walking much or visit in the summer when its just too hot, the Evangelismos station is only about five minutes walking distance away so the hotel is in a convenient location. In fact, we even took the metro system from Evangelismos station to the airport and it was about a 45-minute trip. I am pretty self sufficient and we didn't need room service so can't comment on that but I would highly recommend this hotel as I am not the adventurous type when it comes to hotels and I was very pleased and entirely comfortable during my stay.
reviews.title: Everything You Expect From A Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Hilton Points and they upgraded us to Executive Level which made this one of the best Hiltons we ever stayed at. We didn't have the greatest view, but the balcony was wonderful in such a big city. And, being an American, I loved the American service that went along with this hotel. However, this Hilton was better because most American exec floors don't offer an open bar. This was fabulous, with lots of great sweets and appetizers. No need to buy anykind of beverage the whole time at the hotel. It also was in a great location, walkable to the Acropolois, Old Town, etc. We arrived here after Mykonos (where I didn't want to leave) and I was thinking Athens would be like Rome, a little overhwelming for the end part of a long holiday. But, Athens is great, a lot more laid back and friendlier than Rome...I recommend this hotel 100%.
reviews.title: Very surprised how great this Hilton was....

likes.liked: — Location, great rooms, Executive Level was awesome & balconies in all rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for the first 2 nights during a 11 day trip. The reason we booked this hotel is because I am a Hilton Honors member and had enough points for 2 free nights. We were upgraded to the Executive Floor, which was nice because they had pretty much around-the-clock beverages (including some limited top shelf alcohol) and appetizers in the evenings. The breakfast was simple but nice. There was an amazing view of the acropolis from the lounge (and those rooms on that side). We had complimentary wine and fruit awaiting us in our room when we checked in.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you are used to American hotels and amenities

likes.liked: — Feel of an upscale American hotel, high-level of service and hospitality of the staff
likes.disliked: — Nothing much negative to say, except location could have been better and internet too expensive

reviews.text: The room was extremely clean, spacious, and comfortable. The king sized bed and high quality linens were a nice change to what were had at other hotels in Europe. We also got robes and slippers. Nice, brand-name toilettries were plentiful. We forgot our toothbrushes, and they were kind enough to provide complimentary dental kits. Separate bath and shower, large safe, in-room coffee/tea service, etc. I got ill during the stay, and so we asked if we could check out at 6pm since that was the time we needed to leave to make our flight to Santorini. They were quite accomodating and allowed us to do that with no hassle!
reviews.title: I was hoping for more

likes.liked: — Views from bar and nice room

reviews.text: I have two negative comments. The location could be better. It is 1 block from the Evangelismos metro station (walk 1 block east from the station and you will arrive at the large hotel), so only 1 stop from Syntagma. But, despite how close it is to everything, you still need to take the metro to get there. We stayed in the Plaka at the end of our trip, and the proximity to everything there was great. Secondly, the internet access is cost-prohibitive. We brought our own computer for the trip, and was told that it was 9 euros for 1 hour or 27 euros for 24-hour access. Or we could use the business center which was even more expensive. We ended up using an internet cafe for 1.80 euros/30 min near Syntagma square.
reviews.title: Very good city Hotel
OK, but not worth the money
reviews.text: I had a regular room with an acropolis view, which was very comfortable, well maintained and with its own balcony. Great Shower, but stock standard Hilton toiletries are a bit of a let down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Hilton in an Executive Floor room. This gave us access to the Executive Lounge where we had free breakfast as well as drinks/snacks in the evening. The room was incredible. The bathroom had a large tub with separate shower (with rain - above head- shower head). The lobby is phenomenal as is the Galaxy Bar/Restaurant on the roof -- where you can have drinks or dinner, rooftop, overlooking the Acropolis. The hotel is a block away from the Evangelismos Metro stop -- which itself is 45 minutes away from the airport (10 euro ticket for 2 persons). You can also take the Metro to Syntagma Sq and transfer for the line to the Acropolis. The taxi rides are incredibly cheap though-- about 5 euros to go to the Acropolis from the hotel. The hotel is also walking distance from several museums.
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel

reviews.text: We booked into the Hilton for 3 nights on our way back to Athens after 2 weeks island hopping. We had tried to book some of the other major hotels in the city but they were booked out, so we were satisfied to get a standard room in the Hilton at the high price of 350 euro a night, room only. The hotel was pretty nice and the room was large and comfortable with a view of the Acropolis. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming so why the poor rating?
reviews.title: Major Rip Off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been lucky enough to stay in some beautiful and expensive hotels around the world, including various Four Seasons and the Burj Al Arab in Dubai, but have never met with so many attempts to extort money from us. A movie was 20 euro, internet access 4 euro for 10 minutes, there was 10 euro charge per person for residents to use the gym facilities, breakfast to the room was 40 euro each and the minibar was the most expensive I've ever encountered at 6.50 for a can of Coke!
reviews.title: Modern Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We attempted to order room service from a limited and expensive menu. The 20 euro burger posed no problem but when I tried to order a toasted sandwich as per the menu, I was told it wasn't on the menu and I must be looking at an old version, they would send up a new menu for me to order from. Half an hour later, the burger arrived and no menu. At this stage we were hungry, tired and fed up and decided to check out the following morning rather than have the Hilton experience ruin the end of our Greek holiday. No one asked us why we checked out 2 days early and we happily left for the Semiramis hotel 30 minutes outside the city, where we enjoyed the last 2 days of our holiday without feeling so ripped off.
reviews.title: super hotel

reviews.text: The Hilton is in a lovely neighborhood, a quick cab ride to the main attractions, or if you are up for it, a good walk. The lobby is spectacular and the rooms and bathrooms are very modern with lots of glass and marble. They seemed to have been recently updated. The outdoor pool area was large and quite nice, but very crowded. The indoor gym and pool/spa were available for an additional fee. The rooftop bar has an amazing view of the acropolis and the city. Unfortunately when we returned after dinner for a drink there was no place to sit at the bar or any tables on the terrace. The buffet breakfast was very good offering a huge selection - dishes ranging from typical breakfast fare to delicious local specialties. The staff was fine but no one was tripping over themselves to offer great service.
reviews.title: The best Hilton I have ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent three nights here before leaving on a cruise and highly recommend this hotel. Let me start by advising we arranged for a taxi through the concierge to pick us up at the airport. Nikkos was waiting for us as we cleared customs. He took all our bags and escorted us to a roomy Mercedes taxi. Good service for 40 EU.
reviews.title: A Welcome Respite

reviews.text: We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, whether at the desk or at other areas. We used Hilton points for part of our stay and were put into the Executive Club rooms. The Club room was great to utilize. Good breakfast , drinks and snacks through out the day, and cocktails before dinner. The staff there was always volunteering info to help us take in the city. We also had a memorable dinner on the roof at the Galaxy restaurant. This was a little pricey, but the food and view were great.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel With a Spectular pool

likes.liked: — The outdoor pool and the roof top bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious by European standards. The highlight was a fabulous shower. Others have mentioned the pool, and we agree it was very nice to finish the day there after hours walking through hot Athens. This is not an ordinary hotel pool: the pool itself is quite large, it is surrounded by many lounges and sofas with ample shade.
reviews.title: Nice stay
Great!
reviews.text: Some have noted signs of age. We did notice the carpet in the hall was somewhat worn, but this is a minor point considering the central location (the metro is a 3 minute walk), comfortable rooms with amenities and the solid service. We would highly recommend this property.
I had stayed here before but prior to the 2003 refurbishment. It was always a great hotel but the refurb has brought it up to date.
reviews.title: Service ranges from 1 to 5 star

reviews.text: The hotel is in the Luxury bracket but not 5*. Our room was very clean, spacious, superb view of the acropolis (we were not on the executive floor either), the bathroom was great also. The beds, we had a fold away for our son was also comfortable, not like some where you seem to be sleeping on the floor. Breakfast was neverending the choice was great, Other mealtimes were expensive. If you want and have children, around the back of the hotel is a bakery and Goody's, a fast food resturant, but much better than McDonalds and such. We had three meals and drinks for 15euros. The pool is something else. Very large, worth staying there for the pool alone, and in that heat believe me it was needed. The reception and other areas of the hotel were very cold in apperence not welcoming. But the staff were friendly at all times, even when they had charged us for items out of the computerised fridge which we did not use. They were removed from our bill without any fuss. If you do travel in on the metro from the airport hotel it really is only a five minuite walk. We would stay at this hotel again. Also use the metro to travel around for 80cents you get 90mins worth of travel.
reviews.title: luxury but not 5 star.

likes.disliked: — the clinical empty feel in certain areas.

reviews.text: As a frequent Hilton Guest all over the world and a Gold member,
reviews.title: Amazing hotel Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was one of our best stays at any hilton worldwide.
reviews.title: Amazing! More than we Expected!

likes.liked: — Room and Executive Lounge privileges. Pool too!

reviews.text: The diffrance being the staff.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, but poor service.
Wow, what a pool!!!!!!
reviews.text: Great location , easy access to car rental and Airport transfer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights at the Hilton for a honeymoon.
reviews.title: Great View- Poor Service

reviews.text: When we got there they gave us a "mountain view" room- which is the codeword for the "non-Acropolis view of billboards and dirty city streets"
reviews.title: Best Hilton I have ever stayed in
Luxury hotel convenient to Metro and downtown
reviews.text: The girl at the desk refused to move our room saying they were fully booked. After getting to the room we called the night manager who quickly moved us to another room.
The rooms are very nice- modern and clean. The view is stupendous- especially if you have dinner or drinks on the roof.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.text: My complaints- the staff is incompetent (they also mischarged me on my final bill for an extra night), the porters are better concierges than the real concierges and the service on the rooftop bar is awful- if you love the view you can probably put up with the bad service.
reviews.title: wonderful rooms and views, shame about the staff
Adequete 5 star
reviews.text: This hotel meets most requirements for a 5 star, but only just, and in no area did they exceed expectations. Staff were slightly brusque, the facilities adequete, the room reasonable. It's location is a ten minute walk from the Kolinaki district, fifteen minute walk from the Plaka region of Athens. Nothing special for the money, but no major gripes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Athens Hilton twice while on our honeymoon. We arrived the first time at 315am after 26 hours of travel. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, understanding & helpful. We told them that we needed to take a bus in a few hours back to the airport, & they searched online for a bus schedule for us & printed it out before sending us to our BEAUTIFUL room.
reviews.title: The most beautiful Hilton I've ever seen

likes.liked: — The cleanliness & decor of the room; the breakfast options.
likes.disliked: — It's an hour away from the airport.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hilton - Best in the World!
reviews.text: We stayed on the Executive floor with a view of the city. The room was spotless & tastefully furnished - very modern. The bathroom was marble & had a glass wall into the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast options were extensive & delicious. The Nespresso machine was a little confusing, but hotel staff quickly offered assistance. I asked for a table to be set outside, & by the time I had chosen my breakfast the table was set, complete with fresh flowers.
reviews.title: Very nice
Loved the Hilton
reviews.text: The pool is huge, with dozens of lawn chairs around it. Although the pool was very busy when we swam there (due to the 36 degree weather), its size helped to make it feel less crowded.

description: Hilton Athens is not just a hotel. It’s a legacy in Athens. Consider the fact that a whole area is named after the Hilton and you’ll start to understand the immense name this hotel has had the past 48 years. Socialités, fashionistas, local and international celebrities, you see them here!An architectural marvel, the Hilton Athens has been fully renovated in 2003 to be able to cope with the next episode in its ever interesting life. The hotel boasts 506 spacious rooms and some of the best city views available. You can almost touch the Acropolis! Art is abundant and local artists are used throughout the hotel. Hilton Athens has the largest outdoor pool in the city center and features four restaurants and two bars. The Byzantino restaurant offers Mediterranean cuisine in a renowned atmosphere. At the Milos restaurant, you can taste gourmet Greek cuisine at its best. Aethrion Lounge is where local celebrities and politicians meet for a coffee and the rooftop Galaxy Bar Restaurant truly is the most glamorous Athenian hangout to start out or end your night, to see or to be seen. Remember; people like to dress up here! Be the VIP you are while enjoying a citywide view. The hotel is just 25 minutes away from the airport by direct subway. It features 22 meeting rooms for 2 to 1300 people, a 24-hour Business Center and an Executive Lounge with Acropolis view. For a spa getaway or some pampering time away from the real world, you can visit the Hiltonia Spa, featuring an indoor pool, a fully equipped fitness room, a Pilates studio with natural light and an endless array of health and beauty treatments.
